result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathon J. Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathon J. Olson

records.addlTxt: Letter to Dodge Correctional re: Transcripts

3:23 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jonathon J. Olson appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Jonathon J. Olson. Calling 22CF39 & 22CF40. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Svehlek willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 03:27 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jonathon J. Olson appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared in court for Jonathon J. Olson. Calling 22CF39 & 22CF40. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing. Bail continued. 02:01 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

records.addlTxt:
1:25 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jonathon J. Olson appeared by video, in custody. Calling 22CF39 & 22CF40. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Defendant states he is on probation/has hold. Pfeifer statement to bail. Court sets bond in both cases. adj. 01:31 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
